title: Registration and setup
description: Ready to dive into Buttondown? This resource will help you sign up and configure some important settings before you send a newsletter to your subscribers.

title: Test mode
description: Send test emails to yourself to preview how they'll look to subscribers

title: Building your subscriber base
description: Now that your Buttondown newsletter is ready, it's time to add more subscribers and drive engagement.

title: How do I manually add subscribers?
description: You can easily add an email to your Buttondown newsletter, without an import.

title: Why won't my embedded form submit?
description: Trouble with your Buttondown subscription form? Check your security settings.

title: Tags
description: Buttondown makes it easy to segment your readers by using tags.

title: Importing your newsletter data
description: Buttondown makes it easy to migrate your posts, and subscribers from another service. We'll even do the import for you!

title: Beehiiv
description: Buttondown makes it easy to migrate your posts, subscribers and paid subscriptions from Beehiiv.

title: Importing your data from Benchmark
description: Buttondown makes it easy to migrate your posts and subscribers from Benchmark. We'll even do the import for you!

title: Campaign Monitor
description: Buttondown makes it easy to migrate your posts and subscribers from Campaign Monitor. We'll even do the import for you!

title: Constant Contact
description: Buttondown makes it easy to migrate your posts and subscribers from Constant Contact. We'll even do the import for you!

description: Buttondown makes it easy to migrate your posts and subscribers from Kit. We'll even do the import for you!

description: Buttondown makes it easy to migrate your posts and subscribers from EmailOctopus. We'll even do the import for you!

title: FeedBlitz
description: Buttondown makes it easy to migrate your posts and subscribers from FeedBlitz. We'll even do the import for you!

description: Buttondown makes it easy to migrate your posts, subscribers and paid subscriptions from Mailchimp. We'll even do the import for you!

title: Mailcoach
description: Buttondown makes it easy to migrate your posts, subscribers and paid subscriptions from Mailcoach. We'll even do the import for you!

description: Buttondown makes it easy to migrate your posts and subscribers from MailerLite. We'll even do the import for you!

title: Podia
description: Buttondown makes it easy to migrate your posts, subscribers and paid subscriptions from Podia.

title: Substack
description: Buttondown makes it easy to migrate your posts, subscribers and paid subscriptions from Substack. We'll even do the import for you!

title: Double opt-in and imports
description: There are some circumstances where we may ask your subscribers to re-confirm their subscription.

title: Uploading images in the editor
description: You can use the editor to easily add images to your Buttondown newsletter.

title: Previewing your email / sending a draft email
description: Buttondown allows you to preview your email by sending yourself a draft.

title: Why does my email look different on some clients?
How can I write accessible emails?
How do I include audio in my newsletter?
How do I set sender information?
Sending from DreamHost
description: This guide will help you connect your Dreamhost domain to your Buttondown newsletter.

title: RSS-to-email
description: With Buttondown's RSS automation, you can automatically send a new email every time you publish a new blog post.

title: Multiple newsletters
description: With Buttondown you can connect multiple newsletters to the same account and login

title: Data exports
description: At Buttondown you own your data. That's why we make it easy to download all your data any time you want it.

title: Can I recover my deleted data?
description: The Buttondown team can help recover deleted data within three days of deletion.

title: Teams
description: With our Teams feature you and your colleagues can collaborate on writing and managing your Buttondown newsletter.

title: Deleting your account
description: Buttondown allows you to easily export all your data, and delete your account. But we'll still be sad to see you go.

title: Dormancy
description: Dormancy is a status that allows you to mark newsletters as inactive without deleting them or affecting your billing.

title: Are.na
description: Buttondown makes it easy to connect your Are.na and automatically share your newsletters.

title: Blogger
description: Blogger's "gadgets" make it easy to connect your blog and your Buttondown newsletter.

title: Bluesky
description: Our Bluesky integration makes it easy to automatically post your latest Buttondown email.

title: Carrd
description: You can connect your Carrd site and Buttondown newsletter to collect subscribers.

title: Discord
description: You can send notifications about new Buttondown newsletter emails, new subscribers, or other events to your Discord server.

title: Framer
description: Framer is a great no-code form tool that integrates with Buttondown.

title: Twitter
description: Automatically share your newsletters to your Twitter profile to promote your newsletter.

title: Tumblr
description: Automatically share your newsletters to your Tumblr blog to promote your newsletter.

title: Webflow
description: Is your site on Webflow and your newsletter on Buttondown? It's easy to connect them!

title: WordPress
description: Using custom HTML blocks you can easily add your Buttondown subscriber form to your WordPress site.

title: Pricing
description: Pricing information for Buttondown's paid plans.

title: Subscriber dashboard
description: View all of your subscribers.

title: Collecting and using subscribers’ data
description: Buttondown allows you to collect subscriber names, and create a more personalized email for your readers.

title: Segmenting your audience
description: Tag subscribers & target people based on specific properties.

title: Subscriber cleanup
description: Buttondown can clean up spammy or unactivated email addresses from your subscriber list.

title: Portal
description: Buttondown lets you let your subscribers change their metadata, tags, and more.

title: Keeping your newsletter private
description: Private Mode makes it easy to limit who can see you Buttondown newsletter.

title: Subscribers referring other subscribers
description: Buttondown provides the building blocks to build out your own referral system.

title: Email dashboard
description: You can use filters to customize your email list view.

title: Sending from a custom domain
description: Buttondown allows all newsletters to send from a custom domain. This helps you build a recognizable brand and improves deliverability.

title: Sending via email
description: Use Buttondown's Magic Email Address to send a newsletter without logging into the Dashboard.

title: Surveys
description: Adding a survey to your Buttondown newsletter is a great way to engage with your readers.

title: Replies to your emails
description: Buttondown offers more sophisticated ways to manage your reader replies.

title: Designing your archives
description: You can use CSS to fully customize your Buttondown web archives.

title: Comments
description: Buttondown's comments feature allows you to stay connected with your readers.

title: Paid subscriptions
description: Buttondown offers a variety of ways to offer paid subscriptions – and you'll keep all of the money you make.

title: How to send a teaser email
description: Buttondown gives you the option of sending a "teaser" version of a paid email to encourage free readers to upgrade.

title: Offering perks for paid subscribers
description: Buttondown makes it easy to share special perks and incentives with your paid readers.

title: How do I enable Stripe-managed receipts?
description: Stripe can automatically send payment receipts to your paid subscribers.

title: Sponsorships
description: Does your newsletter have sponsors? Learn how Buttondown can help you manage your sponsorships.

title: Comped subscriptions
description: Gift subscriptions are a great way to "comp" a paid subscription to your friends, family, and favorite readers.

title: Buying a subscription as a gift
description: Buttondown's PaymentElement allows your subscribers to purchase paid subscriptions as gifts for others directly from your subscribe page.

title: Automations
description: Automations are shortcuts that facilitate your perfect Buttondown workflow.

title: Automating welcome sequences
description: You can use Buttondown's automations feature to create a welcome sequence for your new subscribers!

title: Types of automation triggers
description: Triggers are the events that cause a Buttondown Automation to fire.

title: Types of automation filters
description: Filters allow you to set the criteria for when an automation fires.

title: Events & webhooks
description: Events and webhooks allow you to monitor and react to any changes with your newsletter.

title: Open tracking
description: A guide to open tracking, and how to use it in Buttondown.

title: Click tracking
description: A guide to click tracking, and how to use it in Buttondown.

title: Complaint rate
description: An explanation of what complaint rate is and how it's calculated by Buttondown.

title: Gross volume
description: An explanation on what gross volume is and how it's calculated by Buttondown.

title: Monthly Recurring Revenue
description: An explanation on what MRR is and how it's calculated by Buttondown.

title: Pageviews by referrer
description: An explanation on what pageviews by referrer are and how they're used by Buttondown.

title: Permanent failure rate
description: An explanation of what permanent failure rate is and how it's calculated by Buttondown.

title: RSS subscribers
description: An explanation on what RSS subscribers are and how they're used by Buttondown.

description: A guide to UTM parameters, and how to use them in Buttondown.

title: Home
description: A detailed guide to the modules on Buttondown's new home page

title: Customizing your subscriber dashboard
description: You can use filters to customize your Subscribers dashboard to your liking.

title: Customizing your request dashboard
description: You can use filters to customize your API request dashboard to your liking!

title: How do I change my account password?
How do I change my newsletter's username?
description: You can change your Buttondown username in Settings.

title: How do I change my login method?
description: Contact our support team and we can help you change your login method.

title: Pausing your subscription
description: Take advantage of Buttondown's flexible billing to pause your subscription when you need to.

title: Customizing your emails
description: Using CSS you can customize some aspects of your Buttondown email.

title: Localization
description: How Buttondown supports localization for your newsletter.

title: Customizing transactional emails
description: Buttondown's transactional emails, such as confirmation and welcome emails, can be customized using the same email CSS settings as regular emails.

title: Can I use a custom web font?
description: While you can use fonts for your Buttondown web archives, this is a bit trickier on email.

title: Can I add a link to a related email?
description: Our Related emails feature allows you to add a link to another similar email.

title: Excluding emails from the archive
description: You can hide an email from your Buttondown archive by setting it to "Private".

title: How can I hide the top of the Modern template?
description: The top of the Modern template has the newsletter's icon and name, and the email's subject and publication date, which some authors opt to hide using CSS.

title: Can I center my email?
description: Using CSS you can center your Buttondown email.

title: Can I customize the Gmail icon of my email?
description: Customizing the Gmail icon is outside of Buttondown's control.

description: Reference guide for all transactional emails in Buttondown

description: Reference guide for Buttondown's premium welcome emails

description: Reference guide for Buttondown's gift subscription emails

title: Buttondown's pre-flight checks
description: Details about all the checks Buttondown performs before sending your newsletter.

title: Why is my Google Workspace domain not SPF-aligned?
description: Google Workspace alias domains may not have SPF alignment when also used for third-party providers, like Buttondown. In these cases, lack of SPF alignment is expected (for alias domains), and should not be a problem for deliverability.

title: Monitoring your domain
description: Keeping your deliverability high is largely about managing your domain's reputation.

title: Engagement and deliverability standards
description: Buttondown's standards for engagement and deliverability.

title: Fixing a "suspicious link" warning in Gmail
description: You can appeal to Google when your website is flagged as a "suspicious link" in Gmail.

title: What does "images in this message are hidden" mean?
description: When Gmail hides images in your emails, Gmail is trying to protect you from potentially unsafe content.

description: Buttondown allows you to export all your API request data as a csv file.

title: Comment data exports
description: Buttondown allows you to easily export all your comment data as a csv file.

title: Email data exports
description: Buttondown allows you to easily export all your email data as a csv file.

description: Buttondown allows you to easily export all your event data as a csv file.

title: Subscriber data exports
description: Buttondown allows you to easily export all your subscriber data as a csv file.

description: Buttondown allows you to easily export all your survey data as a csv file.

title: Dedicated IP
description: Buttondown is happy to offer dedicated IP addresses to customers who need them.

title: Firewall
description: Buttondown's "Firewall" is an opt-in feature that audits all incoming subscribers to confirm that they're legitimate people.

title: Buttondown CLI
description: The Buttondown CLI allows you to write your newsletter from the comfort of your favorite code editor.

title: Does Buttondown offer A/B testing?
description: Buttondown does not formally offer A/B testing, but we have some options to achieve something similar.

title: Sending RSS-to-email emails on scheduled cadences
What data does Buttondown store?
description: Buttondown will never share your data, and we only store what's necessary to send your newsletter.

title: Stipends and financial assistance
description: Buttondown does not offer author stipends, and we likely never will.

description: Added `churn_date` field and filters to Subscribers API
Removed deprecated subscriber types
Added source filtering to /v1/subscribers
Added `product` to `StripeSubscription`
Removed default filter for status in /v1/emails
New Attachments API endpoint
Split up date parameters into start and end
Exports can now be generated in JSON format
Added new newsletter customization fields to the API
Added new email statuses to really let you peek under the hood
Added UTM filtering parameters to the subscribers API
Added support for passing IP addresses to subscriber creation
Added support for filtering subscribers by undeliverability status and reason
A new `/images` endpoint for you to list your images
Override Buttondown's default collision behavior for new subscribers
Customize your API-borne exports
We've added support for filtering subscribers by referrer URL, too!
We've added support for filtering subscribers by IP address.
